headline: Dimon says Trump tariffs may make 'the soft landing a little bit softer' instead of making the 'ship go down'
summary: The boss of the largest US bank expects to see the effects of tariffs in the coming months, and his hope is that the impact won't be dramatic.

headline: Market Chatter: Citigroup Sees Q2 Banking, Trading Revenue Gains Despite Tariff 'Anxiety'
summary: Citigroup (C) expects banking fees and markets revenue to rise in Q2 from a year earlier, despite

raw.headline: Market Chatter: Citigroup Sees Q2 Banking, Trading Revenue Gains Despite Tariff 'Anxiety'

headline: Citi expects banking fees, trading revenue to climb despite US tariff "anxiety"
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Citigroup's head of banking Vis Raghavan said on Tuesday that performance in its banking and trading divisions will improve this quarter despite "anxiety" over U.S. tariffs.  Dealmaking has stalled this year as President Donald Trump's tariff and fiscal policies roiled markets, fueling economic uncertainty.  Citi's clients consider 10% tariffs as a "floor" and are analyzing to absorb the cost of 10% to 20% tariffs on imports, Raghavan said.

Citi's clients consider 10% tariffs as a "floor" and are analyzing to absorb the cost of 10% to 20% tariffs on imports, Raghavan said.

headline: Citi offers hybrid employees 2 weeks of remote work in August
summary: The perk stands in contrast to tightening in-office requirements at JPMorgan Chase, BNY, Royal Bank of Canada and, most recently, Scotiabank.
